communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: March on the DNC 2024 Communications (CPD)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

All texts and emails sent or received by Superintendent of Police Larry Snelling from December 1, 2023 to September 1, 2024 that contain any of the following keywords or phrases: Gaza, Palestine, Israel, March on the DNC, March on the DNC 2024, U.S. Palestinian Community Network, USPCN, Bodies Outside of Unjust Laws, Coalition to March, Chicago Alliance Against Racist and Political Repression, CAARPR, sight and sound, sight & sound, genocide, protest. 

For any potentially responsive documents, please send full the conversation history and any attachments.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. I am a freelance reporter for Medill News, and I am requesting this information in that editorial capacity.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Maggie Dougherty

title: March on the DNC 2024 Communications (Mayor's Office)

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: March on the DNC 2024 Communications (Mayor's Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

All texts and emails sent or received by City of Chicago Chief Operating Officer John Roberson, Chicago Mayor Brandon Johnson, City of Chicago Chief Financial Officer Jill Jaworski, and former Mayoral Communications Director Ronnie Reese from December 1, 2023 to September 1, 2024 that contain any of the following keywords or phrases: Gaza, Palestine, Israel, March on the DNC, March on the DNC 2024, U.S. Palestinian Community Network, USPCN, Bodies Outside of Unjust Laws, Coalition to March, Chicago Alliance Against Racist and Political Repression, CAARPR, sight and sound, sight & sound, genocide, protest. 

For any potentially responsive documents, please send full the conversation history and any attachments.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. I am a freelance reporter for Medill News, and I am requesting this information in that editorial capacity.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Maggie Dougherty

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Stolen/Lost Firearms ATF California
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Hello, 

I request records of the lost and stolen firearms reported to the ATF from FFTL holders as required by 27 CFR § 478.39a 

The records I request are: 
emails to stolenfirearms@atf.gov
ATF Form 3310.11

Databases or other recording records of the number of stolen/lost firearms and found firearms, including where they were found and whether the guns were used in a crime or attempted to be sold. 

Please limit the search to California
Please limit the search to 2018 to YTD 2024

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Citations/arrests LAPD
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Hello, 

I am requesting records related to the arrests and citations using 41.18 

Please provide me with dates, locations, ages, and other collected demographics of those ticketed/arrested 

Officer deployment records for officers engaged in LASAN CARE+ and RESET operations. The records should include names, hourly costs, and the number of officers involved. 

Please search January 6, 2024 to January 16, 2024.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

title: Flock Installs (Los Angeles County Sheriff's Department)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Hello, 

I am requesting records related to the installation, approval, and locations of automatic license plate readers from Motorola and Flock Safety

Emails from: 
Akeia Dixon - installs@flocksafety.com
Dave@flocksafety.com
garrett@flocksafety.com
Motorola email domain names

Do not include promo emails or emails from hello@flocksafety.com

Communications related to installations. 
Keyword search: 
"installations"
"install" 
"technicians"
"public works"
"rebates"

Copies of attachments. 
Copies of documentation of installations that include their locations, approvals by the city for installations, and contracts related to the installations 

Limit search to: 2018 - 2023

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: David Keith Lynch (January 20, 1946 – January 16, 2025)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry into filmmaker David Keith Lynch (January 20, 1946 – January 16, 2025). His death is widely-known and widely reported; as such, privacy concerns under FOIA Exemptions 6 and 7 are voided, as are any concerns under the Privacy Act. For example, you may find his New York Times obituary at the following link: https://www.nytimes.com/2025/01/16/movies/david-lynch-dead.html

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records of both HQ and all field offices for all relevant names, agencies, organizations, companies and events including but not limited to those cited in the previous paragraphs and/or links as well as a cross-reference with the Southern Poverty Law Center to include any information provided by the SPLC. My request includes but is not limited to 137, 157, 176, 177, 183, 184, 188, and 214 files. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

If any part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to review and release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of responsive documents, as the FOIA requires.

I request that I be properly classified as a media requester. I am an assistant editor at Reason Magazine who has written numerous articles on topics of public interest, and I am requesting these documents in an editorial capacity. Please contact me if you have any questions about my media status.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti

title: Contracts with Private Investigations Firms (Palm Springs Police Department)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All current contracts between the police department and private investigation and/or background investigation companies.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

William Frederick

communications.communication:

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Luigi Mangione December 19, 2024 transportation budget
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:

Data showing the budget of all costs associated with the widely publicized December 19, 2024 "perp walk" of Luigi Mangione upon entering New York City following extradition from Pennsylvania, including but not limited to:
- The cost of transportation via helicopter;
- The cost in man hours of all members of the security team assigned to walk with Mangione;
- An inventory and cost of all weapons used during the walk from the helicopter pad to the building;
- Any additional security detail costs associated with the presence of New York Mayor Eric Adams;
- Any other security or logistical costs related to the transportation of Luigi Mangione into NYCPD custody.

I am a lawyer and journalist and intend to use this information for educational purposes.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rebekah Rini, Esq.

Sincerely,

Matt Bernardini

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FOIA - FBI - David Lynch
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records relating to or mentioning David Lynch (January 20, 1946 – January 16, 2025), famed American artist and film director (see: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/David_Lynch)

If, famed  any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

Please see the following public news article as proof of death: https://apnews.com/article/david-lynch-dies-9107f3ce0b4dd49dbe3dc2ae3c09ed59

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

J Ader

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Crime Data Records Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Offense Level Data
Please provide offense level data for incidents occurring within a one-mile radius of 312 Herbert Street, Cedartown, GA, during the period of December 31, 2021, through December 31, 2024. The data should include, at a minimum, the following fields: Incident number, Occurrence date, Occurrence time, Reported date, Reported time, Offense description, UCR/NIBRS code, Other offense code/statutes (where applicable), Address (if possible, original address not aggregated to block level), Business/location name if available, Latitude, Longitude.

I request that this data be provided in CSV, XLS, or XLSX format.

2. CFS Level Data
Please provide call-for-service (CFS) data for calls within a one-mile radius of 312 Herbert Street, Cedartown, GA, during the period of December 31, 2021, through December 31, 2024. The data should include, at a minimum, the following fields: Call number, Call date, Call time, Call type (if coded, please include code definitions), Call type description (if coded, please include code definitions), Disposition (No Action Taken, Gone Upon Arrival, etc.), Address (if possible, original address not aggregated to block level), Business name (where applicable), Beat, Latitude, Longitude.

I request that this data be provided in CSV, XLS, or XLSX format.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Karli DeBlois

communications.subject: Re: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Crime Data Records Request
communications.communication:
Good Afternoon,

I have received your records request. However, this is not a type of list
that we keep up with nor does any of our systems allow us to pull this
specific data. Pursuant to O.C.G.A 50-18-71(j), No public officer or agency
shall be required to prepare new reports, summaries, or compilations not in
existence at the time of the request.

Thanks,

Cpl. Kathryn Winkles
Cedartown Police Department

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Luigi Mangione Perp Walk Budget

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

- Any and all lists, spreadsheets or other organized datasets that detail potential or substantiated allegations of misconduct and/or impeached or impeachable testimony, created under Brady v. Maryland and/or Giglio v. United States.
- Any and all records regarding substantiated allegations of misconduct or violations of internal department policy or criminal law by specific law enforcement officers.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Dillon Bergin

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Hampden County police disciplinary files
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

- Any and all lists, spreadsheets or other organized datasets that detail potential or substantiated allegations of misconduct and/or impeached or impeachable testimony, created under Brady v. Maryland and/or Giglio v. United States.
- Any and all records regarding substantiated allegations of misconduct or violations of internal department policy or criminal law by specific law enforcement officers.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dillon Bergin

communications.subject: Charlotte and William Bloomberg Library Furniture Purchases
communications.communication:
Mr. Kang,

The below public records request for records related to the purchase of furniture for the Charlotte and William Bloomberg Medford Public Library has been received.
The request does not indicate a time period for the furniture purchases.  Would you kindly clarify the time frame for the requested records?
Thank you.
Janice Spencer

Janice Spencer, Office Manager/Public Records
Law Department, Room 206
Medford City Hall
85 George P. Hassett Drive
Medford, MA 02155
781-393-2470
jspencer@medford-ma.gov<mailto:jspencer@medford-ma.gov>




Medford Public Library
PRL Office
111 High Street
Medford, MA 02155

January 16, 2025

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Sincerely,

Jim Kang

MuckRock News

title: Murder Investigations of Parler W Edwards and Ernest Jones

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Murder Investigations of Parler W Edwards and Ernest Jones
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Documents related to the murder investigations of 71-year-old Parler W. Edwards and 40-year-old Ernest Jones. The murders occurred on October 8th and 9th, 1980 in or near Buffalo, New York. The murders were investigated as part of a task force by the Buffalo Police Department, Amherst Police Department, New York State Police, Erie County Sheriff's Office, Cheektowaga Sheriff's Office, Town of Tonawanda Police Department, Erie County District Attorney's Office and the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI), among others.

I kindly request the disclosure of the following information and records, including but not limited to:
- Autopsy reports of both victims
- Investigation records, including case files, incident reports, and evidence logs
- Audio recordings related to the investigation, such as 911 calls, police radio transmissions, and interviews
- Phone logs and transcripts pertaining to communication between individuals involved in the case
- Interview records, including transcripts, summaries and notes from interviews conducted with witnesses, suspects, and persons of interest
- DNA reports and analysis results related to the crime scene and evidence collected
- Letters, correspondence, and written communications associated with the investigation
- Photographs depicting the crime scene, victims, suspects, and evidence
- Notes, memoranda and internal communications related to the investigation, including relevant inter-agency communications

Further, I request that the scope of this FOIA request includes any records generated by the .22-Caliber Task Force, which investigated the killings.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Michael Battaglia-Szyjka

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: 2024 H1 IAPro data
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I request the listing of OPA allegations in IAPro with a received date on or after January 1, 2024 with columns:
 Occurred date    OPA #    CAD/Incident No    ID number    First name    Last name    Date hired    Incident type    Directive    Finding    Finding date    Action taken    Employee Type 
I request the listing be provided in Excel format so I can easily sort/filter it. Redactions should be done in Excel.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Patron Incident Reports - Jan 2025
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

All Patron Incident Reports submitted for the Area Manager 5 North Region from January 1 2025 through January 15, 2025 inclusive of those dates.

Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit Lucy Parsons Labs for the purpose of public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alexandra Gelzin

The Chicago Park District (the “Park District”) responds to all public records requests by the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq.  Please expect a response by January 24, 2025 by close of business. If additional time is needed to assemble and copy all documents responsive to your FOIA request, we will contact you with a time estimate and a request to extend.

Please note that the Chicago Park District is closed for the observance of Martin Luther King Day holiday Monday January 20, 2025.


Sincerely,
--------------------------------
Karen Choudhury
Freedom of Information Act Counsel
CHICAGO PARK DISTRICT
FOIA: 312.742.4789 | FAX: 312.742.5328
foia@chicagoparkdistrict.com<mailto:foia@chicagoparkdistrict.com>

title: Allegheny District Attorney's Office: Antisemitism training

communications.subject: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request: Requests
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Missouri Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Any public information requests submitted to the state by The Foundation for Government Accountability sent on and between January 1, 2018 and Dec. 31, 2024, as well as copies of any replies and information provided by DSS in fulfillment of those requests.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Samantha Liss

communications.subject: RE: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request: Requests
communications.communication:
Hello, 

To help in the agency's search, The Foundation for Government Accountability email addresses end in "@thefga.org."

title: Operation Padlock To Protect: Summonses, Violations

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Operation Padlock To Protect: Summonses, Violations
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

records related to the NYC initiative “Operation Padlock to Protect,” which targets unlicensed cannabis and smoke shops.

Specifically, I am requesting:
	1.	A dataset or machine-readable file (e.g., spreadsheet, CSV) that includes details of all businesses inspected under Operation Padlock to Protect from the start of the initiative through its entire duration.
	2.	A table of summonses issued, including business names, addresses, inspection dates, and the nature of any violations cited.
	3.	Any subsequent updates or additions to the dataset provided in response to FOIL request FOIL-2024-866-00529.

If a machine-readable format is unavailable, I request the data in an alternative tabular format, such as a tabular text PDF.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

David Riordan
